intro: Silene oligotricha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its small, pink to purple flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in sagebrush communities. Silene oligotricha is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with showy blooms. It is an annual or biennial species, depending on environmental conditions.
